ui::Element Class Reference

Documentation

An Element is a basic building block of the UI. Elements are designed to be scalable so they can be adjusted to different screen sizes so that Apps based on elements are future proof.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

Element events

Enumerator
ENTER 

Enter the element (ie, transition to the Element)

UPDATE 

Update the element.

SETUP 

Setup the element (called at program startup.

UP 

Up Event (like up button pushed)

DOWN 

Down Event

LEFT 

Left event

RIGHT 

Right event

SELECT 

Select Event

BACK

virtual Element* ui::Element::event_handler ( int  event,
const draw::DrawingAttr &  attr 
)
virtual

This method is called on the current Element when an event (e.g., Element::ENTER, Element::UPDATE, Element::TOP_PRESS) happens.

Parameters
eventThe event to execute
Returns
For transitions, the new element is returned; otherwise this

Reimplemented in ui::ListItemCallback, ui::ListItemCheck, ui::ListItemToggle, ui::ListItem, ui::ElementLinked, and ui::List.
